p: Because the HSV-1 TK gene is comparatively small, it should be possible to insert it into the genome of other viruses, to provide a reporter for radionuclide imaging. For example, recombinant HIV and simian immunodeficiency (SIV) viruses encoding the HSV-1 TK has been constructed by using parental viruses lacking the nef gene, which both attenuates them and creates space for additional genomic material ( Chakrabarti et al., 1996). Although originally envisioned as live vaccines that would be safe for use, because of their sensitivity to ganciclovir, these recombinant agents could also be employed to study retroviral infections in animals by SPECT or PET.
